name: RateMyClass
description: The purpose of this project is to ease the hassle of making college schedules. It helps students to find classes that best fit their academic goals and interests through connection with other peers.
using: ReactJS, Node.js, Firebase, Rechart.js, JavaScript, JQuery, HTML, CSS

name: Guess the Song
description: This is a web application that lets users search the artists they like to see their top tracks on Spotify. Users can also listen to the song preview and play a song guessing game to see if they can regconize all the top tracks of the artist they search. If the users can't get the song name, they can simply put the cursor on the song image to see the song name.
using: ReactJS, JavaScript, JQuery, HTML, CSS, Spotify API

name: Mass Shooting Map
description: This is an interactive map of crowdsourced mass shooting data. The map shows the number of people who were killed and injured in each different city. There is an additional table to show the total number of casualties each state
using: JavaScript, JQuery, HTML, CSS, MapBox, Leaft.js

name: Twwiter
description: This is a web application that enables live updates to the information produced by users. Users can sign-in / sign up their accounts and post text or image content on this application. Moreover, users are able to like their own posts as well as other users' posts.

name: Population/Votes Charts
description: We used the data of the population and number of electoral votes for each U.S. state to create three charts with different styles. We also added the filter function so users can search for the state data they want to see.
using: ReactJS, Rechart.js, JavaScript, JQuery, HTML, CSS

name: Pencil
description: This is a challenge for me to build a webiste based on a mocked-up design. I had to write the code to mimic the style as closely as possible. This project helps me master my contorl over the look and feel of a web-page
